member.name: T:Integrative.Lara.BlockOptions
member.summary: Defines options for blocking the UI while executing an event

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.BlockOptions.BlockedElementId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of element to block. Leave empty to block the whole page.
member.value: The ID of the element to block. If left blank, block the entire page.

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.BlockOptions.ShowElementId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the element to show. If set, the element specified will be shown instead of the default block dialog.
member.value: The ID of the element to show instead of the default block dialog.

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.BlockOptions.ShowHtmlMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets an HTML message to show while blocking the user interface. If set, the specified HTML will be shown instead of the default block dialog.
member.value: The HTML message to show instead of the default block dialog.

member.name: M:Integrative.Lara.Element.DescendsFrom(Integrative.Lara.Element)
member.summary: Verifies whether an element descends from another.

member.returns: True if the current element descends from the given element.

member.summary: Determines whether the node is a direct child.
member.returns: true if the specified node is a child; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Appends a child node.

member.summary: Removes a child.

member.summary: Removes all child nodes.

member.name: M:Integrative.Lara.Element.Remove
member.summary: Removes this node from its parent.
member.exception: Cannot remove from parent, the node has no parent element already

member.summary: Used to denote the encoding necessary for files containing JavaScript source code. The alternative MIME type for this file type is text/javascript.

member.summary: 24bit Linear PCM audio at 8-48kHz, 1-N channels; Defined in RFC 3190

member.name: F:Integrative.Lara.ContentTypes.ApplicationXShockwaveFlash
member.summary: Adobe Flash files for example with the extension .swf

member.name: F:Integrative.Lara.ContentTypes.ApplicationOctetStream
member.summary: Arbitrary binary data.[5] Generally speaking this type identifies files that are not associated with a specific application. Contrary to past assumptions by software packages such as Apache this is not a type that should be applied to unknown files. In such a case, a server or application should not indicate a content type, as it may be incorrect, but rather, should omit the type in order to allow the recipient to guess the type.[6]

member.name: T:Integrative.Lara.LaraOptions
member.summary: Lara Web Engine options

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.LaraOptions.AllowLocalhostOnly
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to allow localhost requests only.
member.value: true if [allow localhost only]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.LaraOptions.ShowNotFoundPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Lara will show its default 'not found' page.
member.value: true if [show not found page]; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.LaraOptions.Port
member.summary: Gets or sets the port to use when Lara opens a new server. If zero, a dynamic port wil be assigned.

member.name: P:Integrative.Lara.LaraOptions.AddWebSocketsMiddleware
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Lara will include ASP.NET Core WebSocket middleware. Always set to include unless you are manually including the middleware yourself.
member.value: true if [add web sockets middleware]; otherwise, false.
